author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 12-year-old was run over by a Metropolitan Transport Corporation (MTC) bus on Natesan Road near Royapettah on Tuesday evening.

According to the police, D. Shyam, son of Dakshinamoorthy and Ammu, and living in Royapettah, was a class VII student of a private school in Triplicane.

At 4.30 p.m. on Tuesday, when he was heading back home from school on his cycle, he was knocked down by an autorickshaw.

The boy was then run over by an MTC bus on route 12-G. Passers-by alerted the police.

The body was sent to the Government Royapettah Hospital for post-mortem.

The bus driver Ravikumar and conductor Elumalai were detained by the Anna Square police.

A case has been registered and further investigation is underway.

Motorcyclist mowed down

In another incident, a 20-year-old man was run over by another MTC bus at Guindy on Tuesday morning.

Balamurugan of Nagapattinam, who was living in a lodge at Padi in the city, was heading to work on Tuesday when the MTC bus on route 570 hit his motorcycle from behind on CIPET Road before running over him.

The Guindy Traffic Investigation have a registered a case and are investigating.
title: 12-year-old school boy run over by MTC bus
